text: The body of a young man with a blunt force injury to the forehead. You indicate the location of the body with an appropriate description in the inspection protocol, a evidence label, a photograph, a letter of the alphabet, and outline the position of the body on the floor with chalk. What should be done next?
option1: Carelessly, you search through the corpse and contaminate any potential fingerprints.
option2: After conducting a careful search, you leave the body. A specialist will handle the remains.
option3: You behave carelessly and step into a red fluid.
